revised_title: Respiratory Quotient Studies on Amphibian Gastrula Regions
tldr: The authors developed a method using the Cartesian diver ultramicromanometer to measure the respiratory quotient of different regions of the amphibian gastrula. They found that the respiratory quotient varied between the regions, providing insights into the metabolic processes during early development. This method allowed for a better understanding of the biochemical processes occurring in the developing organism.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
